ratings.comment: Class was pretty easy, but too much work for being a 2 credit class. It was hard to take notes in class because he did not have any lecture slides but would talk about musicians or musical instruments from other countries that you had no idea how to spell. Don't buy the textbook, he will tell you its mandatory and then post all the music on canvas.

Do Not BUY the Soundscapes textbook or subscription. You will use his youtube links on canvas for music. It's a good idea to attend lecture as the two quizzes are based on lecture notes you will take. He tends to wait for class responses and it gets boring but he's passionate and quirky. Attendance is recorded by a sheet & quizzes for discussion.

Though the class uses a book, his quizzes are exclusively based on lecture content. His lectures are a bit dry at times, and he reads off of the slides, but he adds in extra info. In discussion, there is a weekly "quiz" (one question--half the credit is for putting your name on it)--so showing up for discussion is important.

MWR was an absolutely amazing professor. Content in this class was very easy, and with a laid back professor like MWR it was a great experience. All of the quizzes, exams, and papers were very simple and graded easily, and on top of that, he curves grades at the end of the semester. I would highly recommend taking one of his classes.

Not sure why Richardson has a poor rating, I don't think it is an accurate reflection on him. He is clearly passionate about what he does and I enjoyed his teaching. 101 was a breeze if you show up to lecture and discussion; I ended up with a 100 in the class. If you enjoy music his lectures will be easy to follow and interesting.

He really cares about music and he is very knowledgeable. He makes a lot of dad jokes and lectures include a lot of examples so it is easy to follow, but he does not upload the slide so be prepared to take (minimal) notes. The quizzes are extremely easy if you have a good TA. Richardson seems like a great guy.
BORING and never had slides so you NEVER know what you're even supposed to know or ANYTHING he even says...
Knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject.   Not worth buying the text book as he covers everything in lecture anyway.

Eh. This class was fine. Subject isn't that exciting, but it doesn't require much effort to get an A. Discussion attendance and weekly (1 paragraph) journals make up 20% of your grade. Occasional (2 pt.)pop quizzes about textbook reading, but I never read and was still able to get the points. 3 online quizzes (open note mc). Decent 2 cr. class

I enjoyed professor Richardson's class a lot and even raise my interest in music. The lectures teach various cultural music and some basic musical terms. The tests are not hard at all. If pay attention to class and show up in class and discussions, you are guaranteed an AB and above. For a 2-credit course it seems very fair.

His lectures got really dry and I never really knew what to write down. Always felt a little underprepared for quizzes, etc. I could never focus in class and I never knew what to write for the weekly journals. Overall just very confused and didn't get much out of the course.

Thought this class would be a fun introductory music class and relatively easy. Wrong. I swear this guy is permanently bitter over the fact that people take his class as an easy A, because it was way more work than a 2 credit class. He is arrogant and Do NOT take this class unless you're a music major.

I cannot express how much anger I have towards this man. The amount of time/effort he expects from his students to devote to a TWO CREDIT INTRO MUSIC CLASS is so ridiculous and difficult. Very arrogant. Refuses to admit this class is taken as an easy A so he makes it ridiculously harder than he needs to. Do not take with him. He is awful.

He's clearly interested in his subject. He tries to engage students in lecture, but it's not that engaging unless you know music really well. He doesn't usually have slides so you have to guess on how to spell foreign names, but there are also weekly discussion posts and pop quizzes every so often. Lecture is mostly listening to music & clapping.

Took this class as an easy humanities credit I needed. Class itself isn't hard, just much more work than it should be for 2 credits. Prof is very arrogant, awkward, condescending and acts like we're all music majors. Gives surprise quizzes to enforce attendance that are tricky. Didn't even put up slides for us to go off of. Major waste of my time.
